trans-unit.source: Create a StorSimple support package | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a StorSimple support package | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create, decrypt, and edit a support package for your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create, decrypt, and edit a support package for your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Create and manage a StorSimple support package
trans-unit.target: Create and manage a StorSimple support package

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes the various tasks associated with creating and managing a support package.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes the various tasks associated with creating and managing a support package.

trans-unit.source: A support package includes all the relevant logs in an encrypted, compressed format and is used to assist the Microsoft Support team with troubleshooting any StorSimple device issues.
trans-unit.target: A support package includes all the relevant logs in an encrypted, compressed format and is used to assist the Microsoft Support team with troubleshooting any StorSimple device issues.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial includes step-by-step instructions to create and manage the support package by using the:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial includes step-by-step instructions to create and manage the support package by using the:

trans-unit.source: **Support package** section of the **Maintenance** page in the StorSimple Manager service
trans-unit.target: **Support package** section of the **Maintenance** page in the StorSimple Manager service

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple

trans-unit.source: After reading this tutorial, you will be able to:
trans-unit.target: After reading this tutorial, you will be able to:

trans-unit.source: Create a support package
trans-unit.target: Create a support package

trans-unit.source: Decrypt and edit a support package
trans-unit.target: Decrypt and edit a support package

trans-unit.source: Create a support package in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Create a support package in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: To troubleshoot any issues that you may be experiencing with StorSimple Manager service, you can create and upload a support package to the Microsoft Support site through the **Maintenance** page of the service in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To troubleshoot any issues that you may be experiencing with StorSimple Manager service, you can create and upload a support package to the Microsoft Support site through the **Maintenance** page of the service in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You will need to provide a support passkey to allow the upload.
trans-unit.target: You will need to provide a support passkey to allow the upload.

trans-unit.source: The support pass key should be provided to you by your Support Engineer in an email.
trans-unit.target: The support pass key should be provided to you by your Support Engineer in an email.

trans-unit.source: An unencrypted, compressed support package is created (.cab file).
trans-unit.target: An unencrypted, compressed support package is created (.cab file).

trans-unit.source: This package can then be retrieved by the Support Engineer from the Support site when the engineer supplies the pass key.
trans-unit.target: This package can then be retrieved by the Support Engineer from the Support site when the engineer supplies the pass key.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps in the Management Portal to create a support package:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps in the Management Portal to create a support package:

trans-unit.source: To create a support package in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To create a support package in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Devices > Maintenance**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Devices > Maintenance**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Support package** section, click **Create and upload support package**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Support package** section, click **Create and upload support package**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create and upload support package** dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the **Create and upload support package** dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Create Support Package
trans-unit.target: Create Support Package

trans-unit.source: Provide the **Support Passkey**.
trans-unit.target: Provide the **Support Passkey**.

trans-unit.source: This key should be sent to you by your Microsoft Support Engineer in an email.
trans-unit.target: This key should be sent to you by your Microsoft Support Engineer in an email.

trans-unit.source: Check the combo box to provide consent to **automatically upload the support package to the Microsoft Support site**.
trans-unit.target: Check the combo box to provide consent to **automatically upload the support package to the Microsoft Support site**.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: Check icon
trans-unit.target: Check icon

trans-unit.source: Create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple
trans-unit.target: Create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple

trans-unit.source: If you need to edit your log files prior to creating a package, you will need to create your package through the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: If you need to edit your log files prior to creating a package, you will need to create your package through the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple:

trans-unit.source: To create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple
trans-unit.target: To create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator on the remote computer used to connect to your StorSimple device:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator on the remote computer used to connect to your StorSimple device:

trans-unit.source: In the Windows PowerShell session, connect to the SSAdmin Console runspace of your device:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows PowerShell session, connect to the SSAdmin Console runspace of your device:

trans-unit.source: In the session that opens, type the appropriate command.
trans-unit.target: In the session that opens, type the appropriate command.

trans-unit.source: More information about the Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet
trans-unit.target: More information about the Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet

trans-unit.source: The different parameters that can be used with the Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet are tabulated below.
trans-unit.target: The different parameters that can be used with the Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet are tabulated below.

trans-unit.source: S.
trans-unit.target: S.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Required/Optional
trans-unit.target: Required/Optional

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Use to provide the location of the network shared folder in which the support package will be placed.
trans-unit.target: Use to provide the location of the network shared folder in which the support package will be placed.

trans-unit.source: EncryptionPassphrase
trans-unit.target: EncryptionPassphrase

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Use to provide a passphrase to help encrypt the support package.
trans-unit.target: Use to provide a passphrase to help encrypt the support package.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: Optional
trans-unit.target: Optional

trans-unit.source: Use this parameter to supply access credentials for the network shared folder.
trans-unit.target: Use this parameter to supply access credentials for the network shared folder.

trans-unit.source: Force
trans-unit.target: Force

trans-unit.source: Optional
trans-unit.target: Optional

trans-unit.source: Use to skip the encryption passphrase confirmation step.
trans-unit.target: Use to skip the encryption passphrase confirmation step.

trans-unit.source: PackageTag
trans-unit.target: PackageTag

trans-unit.source: Optional
trans-unit.target: Optional

trans-unit.source: Use to specify a directory under Path in which the support package will be placed.
trans-unit.target: Use to specify a directory under Path in which the support package will be placed.

trans-unit.source: The default is [device name]-[ current date and time:yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm-ss].
trans-unit.target: The default is [device name]-[ current date and time:yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm-ss].

trans-unit.source: Scope
trans-unit.target: Scope

trans-unit.source: Optional
trans-unit.target: Optional

trans-unit.source: Specify as **Cluster** (default) to create a support package for both controllers.
trans-unit.target: Specify as **Cluster** (default) to create a support package for both controllers.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a package only for the current controller, specify **Controller**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a package only for the current controller, specify **Controller**.

trans-unit.source: Edit a support package
trans-unit.target: Edit a support package

trans-unit.source: After you have generated a support package, you may need to edit the package to remove customer-specific information such as volume names, device IP addresses, and backup names from the log files.
trans-unit.target: After you have generated a support package, you may need to edit the package to remove customer-specific information such as volume names, device IP addresses, and backup names from the log files.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can only edit a support package that was generated through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can only edit a support package that was generated through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: You cannot edit a package created in the Management Portal with StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot edit a package created in the Management Portal with StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: To edit a support package before uploading it on the Microsoft Support site, you will need to decrypt the support package, edit the files and then encrypt it again.
trans-unit.target: To edit a support package before uploading it on the Microsoft Support site, you will need to decrypt the support package, edit the files and then encrypt it again.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to edit a support package:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to edit a support package:

trans-unit.source: To edit a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple
trans-unit.target: To edit a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple

trans-unit.source: Generate a support package as described in [Create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple](#create-a-support-package-in-windows-powershell-for-storsimple).
trans-unit.target: Generate a support package as described in [Create a support package in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple](#create-a-support-package-in-windows-powershell-for-storsimple).

trans-unit.source: [Download the script](http://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/Script-to-decrypt-a-a8d1ed65) locally on your client.
trans-unit.target: [Download the script](http://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/Script-to-decrypt-a-a8d1ed65) locally on your client.

trans-unit.source: Import the Windows PowerShell module.
trans-unit.target: Import the Windows PowerShell module.

trans-unit.source: You will need to specify the path to the local folder in which you downloaded the script.
trans-unit.target: You will need to specify the path to the local folder in which you downloaded the script.

trans-unit.source: To import the module, type:
trans-unit.target: To import the module, type:

trans-unit.source: Open the support package folder.
trans-unit.target: Open the support package folder.

trans-unit.source: Note that all the files are *.aes* files that are compressed and encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Note that all the files are *.aes* files that are compressed and encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Open the files.
trans-unit.target: Open the files.

trans-unit.source: To open files, type:
trans-unit.target: To open files, type:

trans-unit.source: This will decompress and decrypt the files.
trans-unit.target: This will decompress and decrypt the files.

trans-unit.source: You will note that the actual file extensions are now displayed for all the files.
trans-unit.target: You will note that the actual file extensions are now displayed for all the files.

trans-unit.source: Edit Support Package 3
trans-unit.target: Edit Support Package 3

trans-unit.source: When prompted for the encryption passphrase, type the passphrase used when the support package was created.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for the encryption passphrase, type the passphrase used when the support package was created.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder that contains the log files.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder that contains the log files.

trans-unit.source: As the log files are now decompressed and decrypted, these will have original file extensions.
trans-unit.target: As the log files are now decompressed and decrypted, these will have original file extensions.

trans-unit.source: Modify these files to remove any customer-specific information such as volume names and device IP addresses and save the files.
trans-unit.target: Modify these files to remove any customer-specific information such as volume names and device IP addresses and save the files.

trans-unit.source: Close the files.
trans-unit.target: Close the files.

trans-unit.source: Closing the files will compress them with Gzip and then encrypt them with AES-256.
trans-unit.target: Closing the files will compress them with Gzip and then encrypt them with AES-256.

trans-unit.source: This is for security and speed when transferring the support package over a network.
trans-unit.target: This is for security and speed when transferring the support package over a network.

trans-unit.source: To close files, type:
trans-unit.target: To close files, type:

trans-unit.source: Edit Support Package 2
trans-unit.target: Edit Support Package 2

trans-unit.source: When prompted, provide an encryption passphrase for the modified support package.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, provide an encryption passphrase for the modified support package.

trans-unit.source: Write down the new passphrase so that you can share it with Microsoft Support when requested.
trans-unit.target: Write down the new passphrase so that you can share it with Microsoft Support when requested.

trans-unit.source: Example: Editing files in a support package on a password-protected share
trans-unit.target: Example: Editing files in a support package on a password-protected share

trans-unit.source: An example demonstrating how to decrypt, edit and re-encrypt a support package is shown below.
trans-unit.target: An example demonstrating how to decrypt, edit and re-encrypt a support package is shown below.

trans-unit.source: Edit Support Package1
trans-unit.target: Edit Support Package1

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
